section.name: Overview
section.p:
In order to get your project up and running on Windows, please just follow the steps mentioned below.
Environment
Java JDK 6 Installation and Configuration
Maven 2 Installation and Configuration
Firebird 2.0 Installation and Configuration
Eclipse 3.2 Installation and Configuration
Tomcat 6 (standalone) Installation and Configuration
Finished?
If anything goes wrong, please refer to the troubleshooting page If not reported yet, please let us know.

section.name: Environment
section.p:
OpenUSS 3.0 (Codename: Plexus) was developed in the following environment:
Windows XP Professional Service Pack 2, including Internet Explorer 7 and Mozilla Firefox 2.0.3
Java JDK 6 Update 2
Apache Maven 2.0.6
Firebird Superserver/Classic 2.0.1.12855 and Jaybird Class 4 JCA-JDBC Driver 2.1.1
Eclipse SDK 3.2.2/Callisto, including the plug-ins Subversive SVN Client 1.1.2, Web Standard Tools (WST) and J2EE Standard Tools (JST) 1.5.3
Exadel Studio Pro 4.0.4 for Eclipse
Apache Tomcat 6.0.13

section.name: Java 6 Installation and Configuration
section.p:
The Java 6 JDK can be downloaded from the Sun Homepage. Please set the following classpaths for Windows:
JAVA_HOME - The directory of the local JAVA-JDK installation.
Path - Add the path to the bin-directory of your local JAVA-JDK installation.
You can verify your Java installation by entering java -version and javac into the command shell.

section.name: Maven 2 Installation and Configuration
section.p: Maven 2 can be downloaded from the Maven 2 Site Unzip it into a specified directory, e.g. C:\PathToMaven2.

Refer to the readme.txt in the root directory of your Maven 2 Installation. Please set the following classpaths for Windows:
M2_HOME - The directory of the local Maven installation.
Path - Add the path to the bin-directory of your local Maven installation.
You can verify your Maven installation by entering mvn --version into the command shell.

Create a folder of your choice where Maven can store its local repository (e.g. M2_HOME/repository). You then have to set (uncomment) the configuration entry localRepository in your M2_HOME/conf/settings.xml to that local repository.

section.name: Firebird 2.0 Installation and Configuration
section.p: Firebird 2.0 can be downloaded from the Firebird Site. Please choose the installer method. This makes things easier for you. Just follow the onscreen installation instructions.

OpenUSS requires two databases with the aliases: openuss30 and openuss30-test (During the process of migration you also need a third alias openuss).
openuss30 points to your main database for OpenUSS
openuss30-test points to your main test database for OpenUSS
openuss points to your old OpenUSS database (is only necessary for the migration)
The aliases specified above have to be defined in the aliases.conf file in your firebird installation folder. The database openuss30-test will created automatically during the Maven OpenUSS install process.
But, the database openuss30 has to be created manually before running the application. This can be achieved by running an Ant script found in the project plexus-core AFTER you had run Maven at least once (so that the Java class DatabaseCreater has been compiled). The path therefore indicates where those databases should be created by Maven/Ant.
openuss30=D:\Path_to_your_databases\OPENUSS-30.FDB
openuss30-test=D:\Path_to_your_databases\OPENUSS-30-TEST.FDB
openuss=D:\Path_to_your_databases\OPENUSS-30.FDB
A nice admin tool for firebird databases can be downloaded from the IBExpert Site. Just install it using the onscreen installation instructions.

Afterwards you have to register the databases in the firebird database server via IBExpert.
Just use the function "Register Database" using the following standard settings:
Server: Remote
Server name: localhost
Server version: Firebird 2.0
Database file and alias: the according alias
User name: sysdba
Password: masterkey
The other settings should be left to the standard entries.
The databases have not been created yet. Therefore you cannot open it via IBExpert!

section.name: Download Eclipse 3.2 Callisto
section.p: Download the pre-configured eclipse version and unzip it on your harddisk.
After you have unzipped eclipse go to the Exadel Studio Site and download the free version Exadel Studio 4.0. After the download please follow the onscreen instructions to install it.

Recommendation: If you use a computer with less than 1024MB memory, the usage of the pre-configured eclipse distribution is quite uncomfortable. Instead you should download the lite Eclipse 3.2 distribution. After that configure eclipse according to the following instructions:
Open the Eclipse preferences.
Set the java compiler to version 6.0.
Add the JDK 6 to the Eclipse setting "Java-Installed JREs".
Add m2_repo to the "Ant_Runtime_Properties"
Add M2_REPO to the "Java Build-Path Classpath"
Add to "Team-Ignored Ressources" the pattern target
Install the plug-ins Web Standard Tools (WST) and J2EE Standard Tools (JST) from the Eclipse Update Site (Callisto) including the required dependencies
Install Subversive 1.1 from the Ecplise-Plugin-Site http://www.polarion.org/projects/subversive/download/1.1/update-site/

After that you have to check-out (download) the OpenUSS plexus project from Sourceforge.
Open the repository view of Eclipse and register a new repository with the URL https://openuss.svn.sourceforge.net/svnroot/openuss. Choose the trunk openuss-plexus
For authentication you have to use your sourceforge username and password.
Check out the project openuss-plexus from the just included repository.
Go back to the Java view of Eclipse and execute the Ant-Target "install w/o tests", which initiates the Maven-Install-Process, in the main build.xml. During this process two databases will be created. It is therefore necessary to have your Firebird server up and running.
Import all the child projects of the main project openuss-plexus out of the workspace (Import, don't copy them!).
Define a new server (Apache Tomcat 5.5 from the project folder servers/tomcat) in the server view.
Add all projects to the server.
Start the server in the debug mode to test OpenUSS.

section.name: Tomcat 6 (standalone) Installation and Configuration
section.p: Download the binary distribution of Tomcat 6 as Windows Service Installer and install it on your harddrive. Do not use spaces in your installation path to avoid Facelets Null-Pointer-Exception!

Tomcat needs to have the following additional libaries in its CATALINA_HOME/lib folder:
log4j-1.2.13.jar
jaybird-full-2.1.1.jar
framework-deployer.jar - you can find it in also your framework\deployer\target folder
naming-factory.jar
naming-factory-dbcp.jar
naming-factory-resources.jar
Most libaries can be found in the server\tomcat\commons\lib folder of your project.

section.name: Finished?
section.p: You have succefully completed the installation and configuration of OpenUSS if you see the start screen of OpenUSS after entering the URL http://localhost:8080/openuss-plexus. If this doesn't work, please refer to previous sections or the troubleshooting page!
